creator: jkb@stian.freeserve.co.uk
text:
SSLManagerCommand.java is not invoked in non-GUI mode, yet it sets the System 
Properties:
"java.protocol.handler.pkgs", "com.sun.net.ssl.internal.www.protocol"
and
"javax.net.ssl.debug", "all"

It seems to me that anyway these should be set in jmeter.properties, not in 
the code, and therefore should be removed from SSLManagerCommand.java.

===

SSLManager sets java.protocol.handler.pkgs from ssl.pkgs, or, if that is not 
set, sets it to java.protocol.handler.pkgs if that is set.

It seems to me that again, this should be set in the jmeter.properties file, 
not in the code.

However, if it is found necessary to set it at run-time, then it should add 
the value of ssl.pkgs to that of java.protocol.handler.pkgs, rather than over-
riding java.protocol.handler.pkgs with ssl.pkgs.

creator: jkb@stian.freeserve.co.uk
text:
Just realised that settings in the jmeter.properties file will only be seen by 
the JDK if they are also stored as System properties.

The protocol property therefore needs to be set, but should perhaps be done in 
a common property handling routine rather than in the SSL classes, as it 
applies to all protocols, not just SSL (https).

creator: mstover1@apache.org
text:
It's moved to HTTPSampler for now.  If and when other protocols want to use it
they can either do the same initialization, or we'll find a better place for it
to live.
